value:
<add xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" place="margin">
            <l>Looking at them</l>
            <l>from a distance</l>
            <l>he sees them</l>
            <l>pictorally</l>
          </add>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>He gives</del> <del>It holds the</del> It holds the surrounding</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">[illeg.]. He realises time & change. And </l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">again, he has the painters eye. Now like</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the eye which gives the figures 
            <choice>
              <sic>wh.</sic>
              <corr>which</corr>
            </choice> [houses?]</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">them with the flower & the barbed thorn</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">marble pillar, <del>& pen</del> with light sees,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">There is no fear, but always [meriment?]. No</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">[virtue?] <del>that of light</del> gives, rounds lit up but in</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">great illuminated wid <del>a</del> <del>vi</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>Still it is the world of</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">But still there is something anonymous about</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-espe" key="Spenser, Edmund">Spenser</rs>. He <del>must stand out</del> cannot</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">confine his [characters?] in [huals?]: they are</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">symbolic. He externalises: <del>he</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">embodies [learning?], not as a man, but gives it a</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">[upaint?], a symbolic existence. <del>Still</del> The</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">He shall pass <del>away</del> ignores himself, the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">first mind. The individual. He must</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">and at the same time, forces are at work</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">that are forcing the poet to be conscious of</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">himself, as a separate individual; a man</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">who <del>he</del> is giving something to the world: who</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">asks something: but <del>w</del> who is conscious of the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">worlds scorn & neglect.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Then is the artist thus aware of his birth</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">as <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-gcha" key="Chaucer, Geoffrey">Chaucer</rs> was not, nor <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-wlan" key="Langland, William">Langland</rs>, nor</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-tmal" key="Malory, Thomas">Malory</rs>. He is becoming separate:</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">outside; <del>Not all</del> his [illeg.]</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">No longer a wandering voice, but specialised</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">He is <del>indeed more</del> <del>When he</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>a</del> <del>When</del> <del>And here</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">He was then the first self conscious poet.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The first real poet. And English poetry</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">might have continued to be a book read aloud</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">by the leisured in the great hall <del>were</del> had it</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">not been for the other voice – the voice at the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">back door. Ironically [though?], when</l>

<add xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" place="margin">
            <l>12</l>
          </add>
